definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: When I was in Shanghai, she would tell me about the great changes there.
sentences.chinese: 当我在上海时她总是对我讲上海的巨大变化。

sentences.english: This is an area where the stiffness of the concrete structures significantly changes.
sentences.chinese: 在这个区域水泥结构的粘着力会发生巨大变化。

sentences.english: Ah, what a difference a homegrown financial crisis makes.
sentences.chinese: 啊，一场国产的金融危机令一切大变样。

sentences.english: I've been to China years ago and it has changed out of all recognition.
sentences.chinese: 几年前我去过中国，中国已经大变样了。

sentences.english: The way I see it is Japan has finally had its post–World War II political upheaval.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，日本终于要面对二战之后的政治大变局了。

sentences.english: The period of the Northern Warlords' rule over China was an era of a great change.
sentences.chinese: 北洋军阀统治时期，是个大变局时代。

sentences.english: The venerable Hypertext Markup Language is getting a face lift, too.
sentences.chinese: 流行的超文本标记语言也正在进行大变脸。

sentences.english: This 3-week visit opened their eyes to the dramatic changes in China.
sentences.chinese: 三周的参观使他们看到了中国的巨大变化。

sentences.english: Also, moles or freckles that you had prior to pregnancy may become bigger and darker.
sentences.chinese: 同时怀孕前就有的雀斑或痣可能会变大变深。

sentences.english: Each spring, after he shaved it, he looked so different from before.
sentences.chinese: 等到春天，他一刮了脸，人就大变样了。

sentences.english: Both the vocabulary and grammar have changed considerably.
sentences.chinese: 词汇和语法都发生了巨大变化。

sentences.english: Perhaps the main reason ， however ， centers on dramatic changes in traditional concepts .
sentences.chinese: 然而，主要的原因可能是传统观念发生了巨大变化。

sentences.english: We all know about the great changes taking place in Zhongyuan oilfield.
sentences.chinese: 我们都了解中原油田正在发生的巨大变化。

sentences.english: When she saw the great changes of her home town, all sorts of feelings welled in her mind.
sentences.chinese: 当她看到了家乡的巨大变化，真是感慨万端。

sentences.english: How times have changed since then.
sentences.chinese: 时光飞逝，十里洋场已经大变样儿了。

sentences.english: For all four major websites in the study, there was a complete turnaround.
sentences.chinese: 调查中涉及到的所有网站，最终都完成了华丽大变身。

definition: to have a surprise (idiom); shocked or startled/gobsmacked
to lose one's voice/(to cry out) involuntarily
overwhelmed with shock, horror or amazement/dumbstruck/aghast
to be shocked/to be appalled/to be terrified
to cry out in alarm or surprise
to suddenly change color showing displeasure, bewilderment etc
